result.execSummary:
The defendant James R Caffey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay mandatory $200.00 DNA surcharge and all other costs and surcharges during period of probation. If unpaid, a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant. Cash bail applied.

- No new violations that rise to the level of probable cause.
- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

timeConds.notes: Consecutive to any other sentence; STAYED; to be used by the probation department if they feel any sanctions are in order during probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James R Caffey

records.addlTxt: Received & Filed, PLEA  and SENTENCING HEARING of Original Transcript (23 pages) commencing 03-19-2015, by PAULINE B. MACIOLEK.

Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James R Caffey in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant James R Caffey in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.
Defendant ordered to serve 30 days in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence with credit of (0) days time served, STRAIGHT TIME. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation with the mental health unit for 12 months with the following conditions:
*Court ordered 5 days in the House of Correction, Conditioned time, consecutive to any other sentence, but will STAY the time to be used by the probation department if they feel any sanctions are in order during probation. 
*No new violations that rise to the level of probable cause.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Defendant to pay mandatory $200.00 DNA surcharge during period of probation.  If unpaid, a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
*Defendant is to pay all costs and surcharges during period of probation.  If unpaid, a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk jks

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant James R Caffey not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pretrial conference conducted.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

15RM009958  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
02-20-2015

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant James R Caffey in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant James R Caffey in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
